examples.sentence: る-verbs: Drop る 食べる (taberu) → 食べ (tabe) 見る (miru) → 見 (mi)
う-verbs: Change う-ending to い 買う (kau) → 買い (kai) 読む (yomu) → 読み (yomi) 話す (hanasu) → 話し (hanashi)
Irregular: する (suru) → し (shi) 来る (kuru) → 来 (ki)
〜に行く/来る expresses purpose of movement
Structure: Verb stem + に + 行く/来る
Verb stem: る-verbs drop る, う-verbs change ending to い
More casual than ために行く/来る
Essential pattern for expressing purpose of going/coming

sections.heading: What is 〜に行く/来る?
sections.content:
〜に行く (ni iku) and 〜に来る (ni kuru) express the purpose of going or coming somewhere. The particle に attaches to a verb stem to indicate "go to do" or "come to do" something.

English equivalents:

"go to (do)" "come to (do)" "go for the purpose of (doing)"

Structure:

[Verb stem] + に + 行く/来る

映画を見に行く。 Eiga wo mi ni iku. "I go to watch a movie." / "I go to see a movie." 友達が遊びに来る。 Tomodachi ga asobi ni kuru. "My friend comes to hang out."

children.heading: Verb Stem
children.content:
How to get verb stem:

る-verbs: Drop る 食べる (taberu) → 食べ (tabe) 見る (miru) → 見 (mi) う-verbs: Change う-ending to い 買う (kau) → 買い (kai) 読む (yomu) → 読み (yomi) 話す (hanasu) → 話し (hanashi) Irregular: する (suru) → し (shi) 来る (kuru) → 来 (ki)

食べに行く (tabe ni iku) - "go to eat" 見に行く (mi ni iku) - "go to see/watch" 買いに行く (kai ni iku) - "go to buy" 勉強しに行く (benkyou shi ni iku) - "go to study"

sections.heading: With 行く (iku) - Go to do

children.heading: Common activities
children.content: 映画を見に行く。 Eiga wo mi ni iku. "I go to watch a movie." 買い物に行く。 Kaimono ni iku. "I go shopping." / "I go to shop." 食べに行く。 Tabe ni iku. "I go to eat." 本を読みに図書館に行く。 Hon wo yomi ni toshokan ni iku. "I go to the library to read books." 友達に会いに行く。 Tomodachi ni ai ni iku. "I go to meet my friend."

children.heading: With する verbs
children.content: 勉強しに行く。 Benkyou shi ni iku. "I go to study." サッカーをしに行く。 Sakka- wo shi ni iku. "I go to play soccer." 買い物しに行く。 Kaimono shi ni iku. "I go shopping."

sections.heading: With 来る (kuru) - Come to do

children.heading: Someone coming for purpose
children.content: 友達が遊びに来る。 Tomodachi ga asobi ni kuru. "My friend comes to hang out." 母が料理を作りに来る。 Haha ga ryouri wo tsukuri ni kuru. "My mother comes to cook." 先生が教えに来る。 Sensei ga oshie ni kuru. "The teacher comes to teach." 彼は日本語を勉強しに日本に来た。 Kare wa nihongo wo benkyou shi ni Nihon ni kita. "He came to Japan to study Japanese."

children.heading: Place + に + Verb stem + に + 行く/来る
children.content: 図書館に勉強しに行く。 Toshokan ni benkyou shi ni iku. "I go to the library to study." カフェにコーヒーを飲みに行く。 Kafe ni ko-hi- wo nomi ni iku. "I go to the cafe to drink coffee." 日本に桜を見に行く。 Nihon ni sakura wo mi ni iku. "I go to Japan to see cherry blossoms." 公園に走りに行く。 Kouen ni hashiri ni iku. "I go to the park to run."

children.heading: Present/Future
children.content: 明日買いに行く。 Ashita kai ni iku. "I'll go to buy (it) tomorrow." 週末遊びに来る？ Shuumatsu asobi ni kuru? "Are you coming to hang out this weekend?"

children.heading: Past
children.content: 昨日映画を見に行った。 Kinou eiga wo mi ni itta. "I went to watch a movie yesterday." 友達が遊びに来た。 Tomodachi ga asobi ni kita. "My friend came to hang out."

children.heading: Invitations (ない form)
children.content: 映画を見に行かない？ Eiga wo mi ni ikanai? "Want to go watch a movie?" 明日遊びに来ない？ Ashita asobi ni konai? "Want to come hang out tomorrow?"

children.heading: With 見る (miru) - See/Watch
children.content: 映画を見に行く。 Eiga wo mi ni iku. "Go to watch a movie." 桜を見に行く。 Sakura wo mi ni iku. "Go to see cherry blossoms." コンサートを見に行く。 Konsa-to wo mi ni iku. "Go to see a concert."

children.heading: With 食べる (taberu) - Eat
children.content: ランチを食べに行く。 Ranchi wo tabe ni iku. "Go to eat lunch." 寿司を食べに行く。 Sushi wo tabe ni iku. "Go to eat sushi."

children.heading: With 買う (kau) - Buy
children.content: 服を買いに行く。 Fuku wo kai ni iku. "Go to buy clothes." プレゼントを買いに行く。 Purezento wo kai ni iku. "Go to buy a present."

children.heading: With 会う (au) - Meet
children.content: 友達に会いに行く。 Tomodachi ni ai ni iku. "Go to meet a friend." 彼女に会いに行く。 Kanojo ni ai ni iku. "Go to meet my girlfriend."

children.heading: With 遊ぶ (asobu) - Play/Hang out
children.content: 遊びに行く。 Asobi ni iku. "Go to hang out / go to play." 遊びに来てね。 Asobi ni kite ne. "Come hang out, okay?"

children.heading: Suggesting activities
children.content: 飲みに行かない？ Nomi ni ikanai? "Want to go drinking?" カラオケに行かない？ Karaoke ni ikanai? "Want to go to karaoke?" ご飯食べに行こう。 Gohan tabe ni ikou. "Let's go eat." 映画見に行こうよ。 Eiga mi ni ikou yo. "Let's go watch a movie."

sections.heading: Comparing に行く and ために行く

children.heading: に行く - Simple purpose (casual)
children.content: 映画を見に行く。 Eiga wo mi ni iku. "I go to watch a movie."

children.heading: ために行く - Emphasized purpose (formal)
children.content:
映画を見るために行く。 Eiga wo miru tame ni iku. "I go for the purpose of watching a movie."

| Pattern | Formality | Usage | | ------------ | -------------- | ------------------------- | | 〜に行く | Casual/neutral | Daily conversation | | 〜ために行く | Formal | Emphasis, formal contexts |

に行く is more natural for everyday speech.

See: ために (In order to)

children.heading: Shopping
children.content: 買い物に行く。 Kaimono ni iku. "Go shopping." スーパーに買い物に行く。 Supa- ni kaimono ni iku. "Go shopping at the supermarket."

children.heading: Sports and Exercise
children.content: 泳ぎに行く。 Oyogi ni iku. "Go swimming." 走りに行く。 Hashiri ni iku. "Go running." ジムに運動しに行く。 Jimu ni undou shi ni iku. "Go to the gym to exercise."

children.heading: Cultural Activities
children.content: お花見に行く。 Ohanami ni iku. "Go cherry blossom viewing." 祭りを見に行く。 Matsuri wo mi ni iku. "Go to see a festival." 美術館に絵を見に行く。 Bijutsukan ni e wo mi ni iku. "Go to the art museum to see paintings."

children.heading: Named places
children.content: 東京に行く。 Toukyou ni iku. "Go to Tokyo." 東京に買い物に行く。 Toukyou ni kaimono ni iku. "Go to Tokyo to shop." 日本に旅行に行く。 Nihon ni ryokou ni iku. "Go to Japan to travel." アメリカに留学に行く。 Amerika ni ryuugaku ni iku. "Go to America to study abroad."

children.heading: When going/coming
children.content: 明日遊びに来る？ Ashita asobi ni kuru? "Are you coming to hang out tomorrow?" 今週末映画を見に行く。 Konshuu-matsu eiga wo mi ni iku. "I'm going to watch a movie this weekend." 毎週プールに泳ぎに行く。 Maishuu pu-ru ni oyogi ni iku. "I go swimming at the pool every week."

children.heading: Going with someone
children.content: 友達と映画を見に行く。 Tomodachi to eiga wo mi ni iku. "I go to watch a movie with a friend." 一緒に食べに行こう。 Issho ni tabe ni ikou. "Let's go eat together." 彼女と買い物に行く。 Kanojo to kaimono ni iku. "I go shopping with my girlfriend."

children.heading: Formal situations
children.content: 明日会社に資料を取りに行きます。 Ashita kaisha ni shiryou wo tori ni ikimasu. "I will go to the office tomorrow to get documents." お客様がいらっしゃいます。 Okyakusama ga irasshaimasu. "A customer is coming." [Very polite] どちらへお出かけになりますか。 Dochira e odekake ni narimasu ka. "Where are you going?" [Very polite]

children.heading: を for object
children.content:
本を読みに図書館に行く。 Hon wo yomi ni toshokan ni iku. "I go to the library to read books." [Object]を + [Verb stem]に + [Place]に + 行く

Can be dropped in casual speech:

本読みに図書館行く。 Hon yomi ni toshokan iku. [Same meaning, more casual]

children.heading: Not going/coming to do
children.content: 今日は遊びに行かない。 Kyou wa asobi ni ikanai. "I won't go hang out today." 明日は来ないつもりです。 Ashita wa konai tsumori desu. "I don't intend to come tomorrow."

children.heading: Asking about purpose
children.content: 何をしに行くの？ Nani wo shi ni iku no? "What are you going to do?" [Purpose of going] どこに買いに行く？ Doko ni kai ni iku? "Where are you going to buy it?" 誰に会いに行くの？ Dare ni ai ni iku no? "Who are you going to meet?"

children.heading: Fixed expressions
children.content: 遊びに来てね。 Asobi ni kite ne. "Come visit / Come hang out, okay?" また来てね。 Mata kite ne. "Come again!" 飲みに行こう。 Nomi ni ikou. "Let's go drinking." ご飯食べに行こう。 Gohan tabe ni ikou. "Let's go eat."

sections.heading: With へ Instead of に

children.heading: Direction particle へ
children.content:
Can use へ for destination (less common):

映画を見に行く = 映画を見へ行く (less common) 東京に行く = 東京へ行く (both common for destination)

Note: For "verb + に + motion verb," に is standard.

children.heading: Long-distance purposes
children.content: 日本に日本語を勉強しに来た。 Nihon ni nihongo wo benkyou shi ni kita. "I came to Japan to study Japanese." 京都に寺を見に行った。 Kyouto ni tera wo mi ni itta. "I went to Kyoto to see temples." アメリカに仕事に行く。 Amerika ni shigoto ni iku. "I'm going to America for work."

children.heading: Very casual speech
children.content: 映画見に行く？ Eiga mi ni iku? "Going to see a movie?" ちょっと買いに行ってくる。 Chotto kai ni itte kuru. "I'm going to go buy something real quick." 遊びに来てよ。 Asobi ni kite yo. "Come hang out!"

children.heading: Generally standard across Japan
children.content: This pattern is standard across all regions with minimal variation.

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using Dictionary Form
children.content:
❌ 食べるに行く ✓ 食べに行く

Use verb stem, not dictionary form.

children.heading: Mistake 2: Wrong Stem Formation
children.content:
❌ 買うに行く (should be 買い) ✓ 買いに行く

Form the stem correctly for う-verbs.

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing Particles
children.content:
❌ 映画を見で行く ✓ 映画を見に行く

Use に not で for purpose with motion verbs.

children.heading: Mistake 4: Using を Before に
children.content:
❌ 勉強をしに行く (grammatically wrong) ✓ 勉強しに行く (correct - no を with する)

Don't use を with する before に.

sections.heading: Summary
sections.content:
Key Points:

〜に行く/来る expresses purpose of movement Structure: Verb stem + に + 行く/来る Means "go/come to do (something)" Verb stem: る-verbs drop る, う-verbs change ending to い More casual than ために行く/来る Common in daily conversation Used for invitations: 〜に行かない？ Essential pattern for expressing purpose of going/coming Works with any action verb Very natural and commonly used
